intro: Diplochaete, commonly known as the "feverfew" or "false feverfew," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their small, often clustered flowers and hairy stems. They are native to various regions in the Americas and are typically found in grassy or disturbed habitats. Diplochaete species are perennial herbs that often have a rosette growth form. Their botanical features include alternate leaves and a distinct flowering structure that contributes to their ecological and medicinal significance.
